Sentencas: Cr poisoning of cathode materials is one of the main degradation issues hampering the operation of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Hybrid Electrochemical Deposition Route for the Facile Nanofabrication of a Cr-Poisoning-Tolerant La(Ni,Fe)O3-δ Cathode for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: To overcome this shortcoming, LaNi0.6Fe0.4O3-delta (LNF) has been developed as an alternative cathode material owing to its superior chemical stability in Cr environments.
Titulo: Hybrid Electrochemical Deposition Route for the Facile Nanofabrication of a Cr-Poisoning-Tolerant La(Ni,Fe)O3-δ Cathode for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: In this study, we develop a hybrid electrochemical deposition technique to fabricate a nanostructured LNF-gadolinium-doped ceria (GDC) (n-LNF-GDC) cathode with enhanced active reaction sites for the oxygen reduction reaction.
Titulo: Hybrid Electrochemical Deposition Route for the Facile Nanofabrication of a Cr-Poisoning-Tolerant La(Ni,Fe)O3-δ Cathode for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: For this purpose, Fe and Ni cations are co-deposited onto an electrically conductive carbon nanotube-modified GDC backbone by electroplating, whereas La cations are successively deposited through a chemically assisted electrodeposition method.
Titulo: Hybrid Electrochemical Deposition Route for the Facile Nanofabrication of a Cr-Poisoning-Tolerant La(Ni,Fe)O3-δ Cathode for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The proposed method involves a low-temperature (900 degrees C) calcination step of electrodeposited cations, which avoids the need of fabricating a GDC diffusion barrier layer which is otherwise needed to avoid the formation of insulating phases (e.g., La2Zr2O7) when fabricating by conventional high-temperature >= 1000 degrees C) sintering.
Titulo: Hybrid Electrochemical Deposition Route for the Facile Nanofabrication of a Cr-Poisoning-Tolerant La(Ni,Fe)O3-δ Cathode for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Scanning electron microscopy images reveal a unique nanofibrous structure of n-LNF-GDC, which is believed to play an instrumental role in enhancing the electrochemical characteristics by increasing the active triple-phase boundaries.
Titulo: Hybrid Electrochemical Deposition Route for the Facile Nanofabrication of a Cr-Poisoning-Tolerant La(Ni,Fe)O3-δ Cathode for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: An anode-supported SOFC with the n-LNF-GDC cathode showed the superior performance of 0.984 W cm(-2) at an intermediate temperature of 750 degrees C as compared to the power densities of 0.495 and 0.874 W cm(-2) produced by LNF-GDC and state-of-the-art La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-delta (LSCF)-GDC composite cathodes fabricated by conventional sintering.
Titulo: Hybrid Electrochemical Deposition Route for the Facile Nanofabrication of a Cr-Poisoning-Tolerant La(Ni,Fe)O3-δ Cathode for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: A short-term accelerated Cr-poisoning durability test indicated good electrochemical stability of n-LNF-GDC, whereas LSCF exhibited severe degradation.
Titulo: Hybrid Electrochemical Deposition Route for the Facile Nanofabrication of a Cr-Poisoning-Tolerant La(Ni,Fe)O3-δ Cathode for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The electrochemically engineered nanostructured n-LNF-GDC can serve as an effective cathode for SOFCs to achieve high performance and long-term durability.
Titulo: Hybrid Electrochemical Deposition Route for the Facile Nanofabrication of a Cr-Poisoning-Tolerant La(Ni,Fe)O3-δ Cathode for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
